intro: Forsteronia macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved forsteria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in warm climates. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and private collections.
